clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation and Prognostic Indications of Systemic Inflammation in Liver Cirrhosis Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Investigate systemic inflammation in liver cirrhosis patients

primary_outcome.description: Overt upper GI bleeding due to esophagogastric varices, ulcers and other causes; Identified by clinical manifestations, lab tests and endoscopy and measured by number/proportion of patients
Deaths caused by variceal bleeding, hepatocellular carcinoma, liver failure, etc

secondary_outcome.measure: New or worsening acute decompensation event other than upper GI bleeding
secondary_outcome.description: Ascites, Hepatic encephalopathy, systemic infection, spontaneous bacterial peritonitis, hepatorenal syndrome, etc Identified by clinical manifestations, lab tests and images according to renown practice guidelines and measured by number/proportion of patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Liver transplantation/ Transfer to other non-endoscopic therapies
secondary_outcome.description: Undergo liver transplantation, or transferred to surgical, radio-interventional, or other non-endoscopic therapies; Measured by number/proportion of patients

arm_group.description: Patients receiving both endoscopic therapy and non-selective beta-blockers for treating high-risk esophagogastric varices
Patients receiving mono endoscopic therapy for treating high-risk esophagogastric varices

study_pop.textblock: Patients of liver cirrhosis with high-risk bleeding esophaogastric varices
